Text: Enjoyed stopping by Upshur Street Books today. Celebrate Small Business Saturday by supporting a business near you. https://t.co/udTcIhxtOC
Name: President Obama

Text: Happy Thanksgiving, everyone! Today, we give thanks for all of our loved ones and the brave men and women in uniform who serve our country.
Name: President Obama

Text: Slamming the door in the face of refugees would betray our deepest values. That's not who we are. And it's not what we're going to do.
Name: President Obama

Text: Welcoming the world’s vulnerable who seek the safety of America is not new to us. We've safely welcomed 3 million refugees since 1975.
Name: President Obama

Text: Here, our focus is giving safe haven to the most vulnerable Syrians – women, children, and survivors of torture.
Name: President Obama

Text: We will provide refuge to at least 10,000 refugees fleeing violence in Syria over the next year after they pass the highest security checks.
Name: President Obama

Text: We also win this fight with our values. America can ensure our own security while welcoming refugees desperately seeking safety from ISIL.
Name: President Obama

Text: Protecting the American people is my top priority. With our 65 global partners, we're leading the campaign to degrade and destroy ISIL.
Name: President Obama

Text: This is an American hero: Capt. Groberg put it all on the line for his team. On his worst day, he gave us his best. https://t.co/WdWAPswJpE
Name: President Obama

Text: Today, we honor the incredible men and women who have served our country. Their sacrifice and selflessness is second to none.
Name: President Obama

Text: I just launched my Facebook page with a video on climate change. America will lead on this. The time to act is now. https://t.co/WG5y1FbhIA
Name: President Obama

Text: Every American deserves quality, affordable health care. If you or a friend needs coverage, go to https://t.co/PJ7xIL6FjY and sign up now.
Name: President Obama

Text: Who knew community policing could involve the Nae Nae? Great example of police having fun while keeping us safe: https://t.co/ZGeTDm6OYw
Name: President Obama

Text: Good to be home for a night. Even better to see the @chicagobulls start the season off right! #SeeRed
Name: President Obama

Text: Our thoughts are with the Mexican people as they brace for Hurricane Patricia. USAID disaster experts are on the ground and ready to help.
Name: President Obama

Text: Happy Back to the Future Day, @RealMikeFox! Ever think about the fact that we live in the future we dreamed of then? That's heavy, man.
Name: President Obama

Text: So I'm eager to hear from folks in Charleston today on actions we can take to put recovery within reach for anyone who needs it.
Name: President Obama

Text: Communities are showing that we should approach substance use disorders as an opportunity to intervene rather than a race to incarcerate.
Name: President Obama

Text: With no other disease do we expect people to wait until they're a danger to themselves or others to self-diagnose and seek treatment.
Name: President Obama

Text: 4 in 5 heroin users started out by misusing prescription opioids. Heroin-related deaths nearly quadrupled between 2002 and 2013.
Name: President Obama

Text: Sales of powerful painkillers have skyrocketed. In 2012, enough prescriptions were written to give every American adult a bottle of pills.
Name: President Obama

Text: 120 Americans die every day from drug overdoses - most involving legal prescription drugs. That's more than from car crashes.
Name: President Obama

Text: Heading to West Virginia today to talk about the epidemic of prescription drug abuse in America and what we can do to help. The facts:
Name: President Obama

Text: RT @FactsOnClimate : Climate change threatens us all, and it will take all of us to solve it. Get the facts on how we can: https://t.co/D0uInQ4O6t #ActOnClimate
Name: President Obama

Text: I got a chance to catch up with the @Space_Station crew today. Nothing like a call to space on #AstronomyNight! https://t.co/JVLzYDQ8Jo
Name: President Obama

Text: I just met with CEOs of some of our biggest companies who are stepping up to #ActOnClimate. It's good for the planet - and the bottom line.
Name: President Obama

Text: Congrats @HokuleaWWV on reaching Africa—midpoint of worldwide voyage to spread message of caring for the one planet we've got. #MalamaHonua
Name: President Obama

Text: Congrats @Cubs - even @whitesox fans are rooting for you!
Name: President Obama

Text: Thanks, Zack. https://t.co/gOGzWmYdxQ
Name: President Obama

Text: We have a moral responsibility to do what we can for families forced from their homes. Find out how you can help at http://t.co/J8A6mTD6D4.
Name: President Obama

Text: But this isn't just about what I can do as President. Every single one of us - from citizens to NGOs - can help refugees find safe haven.
Name: President Obama

Text: We're also increasing the number of Syrian and other refugees we admit to the U.S. to 100,000 per year for the next two years.
Name: President Obama

Text: We've provided more than $4.5 billion in humanitarian aid to help meet the needs of those impacted by the Syrian conflict.
Name: President Obama

Text: Nearly 12 million people have been displaced by the conflict in Syria. As Americans, we can't sit idly by. That's not who we are.
Name: President Obama

Text: I'm grateful for the teachers who helped spark my sense of curiosity. The #62MillionGirls who aren't in school should have that same chance.
Name: President Obama

Text: Yogi Berra was an American original - a Hall of Famer, jovial prophet, & a humble veteran. We'll miss you, Yogi, but your legacy ain't over.
Name: President Obama

Text: Welcome to the White House, @Pontifex! Your messages of love, hope, and peace have inspired us all.
Name: President Obama

Text: Millions of families are more secure thanks to the ACA. Join them and #GetCovered on Nov 1: http://t.co/PJ7xIL6FjY  https://t.co/GF6yS0aHol
Name: President Obama

Text: Our right to vote is sacred. It's the foundation of our democracy. You can find out how to register to vote at http://t.co/8kaqY0U3fn.
Name: President Obama

Text: Cool clock, Ahmed. Want to bring it to the White House? We should inspire more kids like you to like science. It's what makes America great.
Name: President Obama

Text: We've fought back because of you. We shouldn't slip back because of Congress. I urge them to send me a budget that invests in our future.
Name: President Obama

Text: When I took office, the budget deficit had reached 9.2% of our GDP. We've cut that down to 2.8%. http://t.co/3viaw4b0bB
Name: President Obama

Text: When I took office, 15.4% of our population was uninsured. Today, we’ve cut that by more than a third. http://t.co/3OOqcz8Oxp
Name: President Obama

Text: In 2009, our auto industry was flatlining. Now our workers are on pace to sell more American cars and trucks than any year since 2001.
Name: President Obama

Text: We've cut the unemployment rate in half – from a high of 10% down to 5.1%. And we're not done. http://t.co/uRfaSoiGuA
Name: President Obama

Text: When I took office, 800,000 Americans lost their jobs each month. Our businesses have now added 13.1 million jobs over 66 straight months.
Name: President Obama

Text: 7 years ago today, Lehman Brothers filed for bankruptcy, setting off the worst financial crisis in decades. Here's how far we've come:
Name: President Obama

Text: "@FAFSA" might be hard to say, but filling it out can help you pay for college. FLOTUS, you're up! #5TimesFAFSA http://t.co/y1Jv8aeGUH
Name: President Obama

Text: 14 years after the terrorist attacks of 9/11, we honor those we lost. We salute all who serve to keep us safe. We stand as strong as ever.
Name: President Obama

Text: Today's Senate vote on the Iran deal is a historic step toward preventing Iran from obtaining a nuclear weapon. The world is safer for it.
Name: President Obama

Text: Thank you, Colin, for putting your experience and expertise behind this important initiative for our country. https://t.co/bSnaLMs8CU
Name: President Obama

Text: I loved Alaska and met so many inspiring people. Have to keep up the fight on climate change for their sake—and ours. http://t.co/HzWW0S6iQc
Name: President Obama

Text: Today we’re returning Mount McKinley to its native name - Denali, a step to reflect the heritage of Alaska Natives. http://t.co/WyzQImKymX
Name: President Obama

Text: In Treme, I was inspired by the progress & people 10 years after Katrina. It gives us hope, but our work isn't done. http://t.co/LDqsARhnZt
Name: President Obama

Text: Amidst global volatility, Congress should protect the momentum of our growing economy (not kill it). We must avoid shutdown / austerity.
Name: President Obama

Text: The National Park Service: 99 years and 84 million acres strong. Congrats to all who work to protect these treasures. http://t.co/R8RyB9vkVW
Name: President Obama

Text: President Carter is as good a man as they come. Michelle and I are praying for him and Rosalynn. We're all pulling for you, Jimmy.
Name: President Obama

Text: Due to popular request, here are my vacation playlists: http://t.co/uer5sIl4Vk http://t.co/zHEekHvQBr What's your favorite summer song?
Name: President Obama

Name: President Obama

Text: Thank you for all you've done to protect our sacred right to vote. It's as important today as it's ever been. https://t.co/ge74wu5nc1
Name: President Obama

Text: Heroes like @RepJohnLewis, Dr. King, and countless others sacrificed so that all of our voices could be heard. http://t.co/L7kxtWQlYW
Name: President Obama

Text: Before 1965, African Americans faced poll taxes, literacy tests, or having to count jellybeans in a jar when they tried to register to vote.
Name: President Obama

Text: 50 years ago today, President Johnson signed the Voting Rights Act into law, securing the right to vote for millions of African Americans.
Name: President Obama

Text: Pretty incredible time lapse of the dark side of the moon passing Earth from @NASA. American ingenuity at work! http://t.co/JKep9bcxGQ
Name: President Obama

Text: Important detail – there are no secret deals. My staff can brief you on any question about any part of the deal. https://t.co/UO0B5xCOPh
Name: President Obama

Text: The choice is ultimately between diplomacy and war. Iran's nuclear program accelerates if Congress kills this deal. https://t.co/nvBeO1Omko
Name: President Obama

Text: It's the strongest nuclear deal ever negotiated. There's no such thing as a "better deal." Walking away risks war. https://t.co/la7GhQXfzl
Name: President Obama

Text: I refuse to condemn our kids to a planet that's beyond fixing. Let's meet this challenge and #ActOnClimate together.
Name: President Obama

Text: Despite what the critics will tell you, this plan will ultimately save the average American family nearly $85 a year on their energy bills.
Name: President Obama

Text: Thanks to this plan, there will be 90,000 fewer asthma attacks among our kids and we'll avoid 3,600 premature deaths in 2030.
Name: President Obama

Text: It's time to change that. With the Clean Power Plan, by 2030, carbon pollution from power plants will be 32% lower than it was a decade ago.
Name: President Obama

Text: Right now, power plants account for about one-third of America’s carbon pollution. That’s more than our cars, airplanes, and homes combined.
Name: President Obama

Text: Levels of carbon dioxide in our atmosphere are higher than they’ve been in 800,000 years. 2014 was the planet’s warmest year on record.
Name: President Obama

Text: Today, we're announcing America's Clean Power Plan—the most important step we've ever taken to combat climate change. Here are the facts:
Name: President Obama

Text: Hey @StationCDRKelly, loving the photos. Do you ever look out the window and just freak out?
Name: President Obama

Text: Launching a pilot program to help students in prison pay for college, because everyone willing to work for it deserves a second chance.
Name: President Obama

Text: Happy 50th birthday, Medicare and Medicaid! Two programs, one promise: that every American deserves a basic measure of dignity and security.
Name: President Obama

Text: 25 years of the ADA and Americans with disabilities are breaking more barriers than ever, making all of us more free. Let's keep going.
Name: President Obama

Text: Proud to be the first American President to visit Kenya. Happy to see family, and to talk with young Kenyans about the future.
Name: President Obama

Text: E.L. Doctorow was one of America's greatest novelists. His books taught me much, and he will be missed.
Name: President Obama

Name: President Obama

Text: Congrats to Oregon on passing two years of free community college! Every hardworking student deserves access to higher education.
Name: President Obama

Name: President Obama

Text: Good conversation with Tom Friedman on the deal we reached with Iran. It's a major step toward a safer world.  https://t.co/xwSrH9IoFG
Name: President Obama

Text: Mass incarceration doesn't work. Let's build communities that give kids a shot at success and prisons that prepare people for a 2nd chance.
Name: President Obama

Text: We could eliminate tuition at every public college and university in America with the $80 billion we spend each year on incarcerations.
Name: President Obama

Text: The $80 billion we spend each year on incarcerations could double the salary of every high school teacher in America.
Name: President Obama

Text: The $80 billion we spend each year to keep people incarcerated could pay for universal pre-K for every 3-year-old and 4-year-old in America.
Name: President Obama

Text: In 1980, there were 500,000 people in American jails. Today, there are 2.2 million. Many belong. But too many are nonviolent offenders.
Name: President Obama

Text: America keeps more people behind bars than the top 35 European countries combined.
Name: President Obama

Text: America is home to 5% of the world's population, but 25% of the world's prisoners.
Name: President Obama

Text: Just spoke to the NAACP about criminal justice reform, something many broadly agree on. Some stats:
Name: President Obama

Text: The uninsured rate is the lowest it's ever been. Let's keep at it until every American has quality, affordable health insurance.

Text: More than 137 million Americans have guaranteed access to preventive care like cancer screenings and birth control at no out-of-pocket cost.
Name: President Obama

Text: Women can no longer be charged more for health coverage just for being women.
Name: President Obama

Text: 129 million Americans with pre-existing conditions can no longer be denied health coverage.
Name: President Obama

Text: More than 16 million Americans have gained health coverage after 5 years of the Affordable Care Act.
Name: President Obama

Text: Today's decision is a victory for every hardworking American. Access to quality, affordable health care is a right, not a privilege.
Name: President Obama
